description: I truely enjoy this platform I wrote to help people make desktop apps with basic knowledge of web design. I hope you enjoy this app as much as I enjoyed creating it. I look forward to your feedback and hope to make this as helpfull as it can be for everyone who uses it.

You have to use first:

sudo apt-get --purge remove wdos

This does not remove the snap files, to do so:

snap remove wdos

If the last line does work, you have to physically go into home/snap and delete the directory by hand.
I have never seen something that simple and yet that resilient.

Else, run smoothly I must say.
